pkgmetadata.longdescription: Threshold and AUC Estimation with Right-Censored Data at a Fixed Time t // We focus on the estimation of optimal thresholds and AUCs when the outcome of interest is the status (alive or dead) of the subjects at a certain time-point t. This binary status is determined by right-censored times to event and it is missing for those subjects censored before t. Here we provide three methods (missing exclusion, imputation of censored times and using time-dependent ROC curves) to estimate optimal thresholds and AUCs in this context. Two references for the methods used here are Skaltsa et al. (2010) doi:10.1002/bimj.200900294 and Heagerty et al. (2000) doi:10.1111/j.0006-341x.2000.00337.x.
